findings.title: I1: Inconsistent error messages
findings.description: The StakingRewards contract contains ambiguous error messages (numbers), e.g., require (_stakingToken != _rewardToken, "69" ); and the rest of the codebase uses custom errors.

findings.title: I2: The withdraw function has ambiguous errors
findings.description: The `withdraw` contract doesn’t have any error handling, instead of it, it relies on reverts on under/overflow.

findings.title: H1: Anyone can prevent other users from getting rewards
findings.description: The Staking Owner has elevated privileges to set RewardsDistribution and StakingRewards contracts, adjust reward rates, and recover lost tokens, allowing them to perform arbitrary actions and potentially prevent other users from receiving rewards.

findings.title: M1: WETH sent to the staking can be locked forever
findings.description: The RewardsDistribution contract allows setting an arbitrary amount of WETH to the staking contract without proper validation, which can cause funds to be locked in the staking because they are not paid or included in another period.

findings.title: M2: Missing data validation for setNewRewardsDistribution
findings.description: The `setNewRewardsDistribution` function is missing any data validation which can lead to incorrect values being passed and succeeding instead of reverting.

findings.title: M3: The reward duration can be set as a zero
findings.description: In the constructor, the `rewardsDuration` variable is set without data validation, which can lead to permanent DoS of the `notifyRewardAmount` function if set to zero.

findings.title: L1: Zero-address checks in constructors
findings.description: The contracts are missing zero-address checks for input parameters that are passing addresses in their constructors.

findings.title: W1: Slippage overflow on type-casting
findings.description: The `slippageBp` variable is susceptible to integer overflow due to unsafe type-casting, which could lead to issues if slippage limits are adjusted in future development.

findings.title: W2: Possible overflow on Uniswap interaction
findings.description: The `_sellRewardAmountOutMinimum` function has unsafe type-casting that can potentially result in integer overflow.

findings.title: W3: Unlimited allowance
findings.description: In the constructor, there is granted unlimited allowance to Uniswap and StakingRewards.
